label: Employee Benefits Policy Communication
quote: 4.5.16 Interpret and prepare informative material for employees on new, changed, and pending policy, and outlines impact on existing benefit program entitlements.

label: Complex Retirement Case Assistance
quote: 4.5.17 Assist with difficult and complex cases such as disability retirements involving sensitive and controversial problems.

label: Employee Counseling for Benefit Decisions
quote: 4.5.18 Assist with counseling employees to ensure that all pertinent information has been received before employee benefit-related decisions is rendered.

label: Military Deposit Process Explanation
quote: 4.5.19 Assist with explaining the process to employees wanting information regarding making post-56 military deposit and how they may receive additional service credit towards retirement.

label: Retirement Correspondence and Congressional Inquiry Response
quote: 4.5.20 Assist with preparing sensitive correspondence on complex retirement and benefits matters and prepare responses to congressional inquiries.

label: Monthly Status Report Delivery
quote: The contractor will deliver a Monthly Status Report (MSR) detailing updated activities support by task.

label: Monthly Status Report Due Date
quote: The MSR is due to CBP by the 7th day (calendar day) of each month. Should the 7th day of the month fall on the weekend, or Federal Holiday, the report is to be submitted the first Federal workday after the preceding weekend or Federal Holiday.

label: Monthly Status Report Content Requirements
quote: The MSR for each task order will include the following: 5.1.1 CBP task number and description; 5.1.2 NPD-RABAS Branch breakdown of hours completed by labor category; 5.1.3 Total funding for the NPD-RABAS Branch task; 5.1.4 Positions and name of the contract employees on board; 5.1.5 Positions and name of the contract employees with Background Investigation (BI) pending (Must notify COR in writing immediately if any contractor employee with pending BI is no longer available for the CBP position); 5.1.6 Positions vacant 5.1.7 Running total on amount billed by months; 5.1.8 Total funding remain on the task; and 5.1.9 Notes to provide explanation and clarity on updated activities and invoice revision or unusual issues such as errors in invoice billing or unplanned risk.

label: Draft Quality Control Plan Delivery
quote: Section 3.8.3 Draft Quality Control Plan NLT 5 calendar days after contract award date Once

label: Final Quality Control Plan Delivery
quote: Section 3.8.4 Final Quality Control Plan NLT 15 calendar days after contract award date Once

label: Final Transition-In Plan Delivery
quote: Section 3.9.2 Final Transition-In Plan NLT 5 calendar days after contract award date Once

label: Transition-Out Plan Delivery
quote: Section 3.9.3 Transition-Out Plan NLT 60 calendar days prior to end of the option year three Once

label: Non-disclosure Agreement Submission
quote: Section 3.10 Non-disclosure Agreement Prior to onboarding new contractor employees Once

label: Monthly Status Report Submission
quote: Monthly Status Report 7th day (calendar day) of each month.

label: Security Awareness and Privacy Training Completion
quote: All contractor employees and subcontractors that have access to sensitive DHS/CBP data and to Sensitive Personally Identifiable Information (SPII) are required to complete IT security awareness training on an annual basis.

label: Annual Notification of Training Completion Submission
quote: Contractors are required to submit an annual notification to the COR indicating the required training has been completed for all contractor employees and subcontractors. This notification will be in the form of an email. This email must include the last name, first name, and date training was completed.

label: Initial Training and Notification Before Work Eligibility
quote: This initial training and notification will be completed before any contract employee or subcontractor will be allowed to perform work related to this SOW.

label: Training for New Employees/Subcontractors Before Work Eligibility
quote: During the course of this effort, any new contract employees and/or subcontractors must complete this training before they will be allowed to perform work related to this SOW;

label: Compliance with Federal and DHS Security Requirements
quote: The Contractor is fully responsible and accountable for ensuring compliance with all Federal Information Security Management Act (FISMA), National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS), and related DHS security control requirements (to include configuration guides, hardening guidance, DHS Security Policy, Procedures, and Architectural guidance). All services provided under this contract must be compliant with DHS Information Security Policy, identified in MD140-01, Information Technology Systems Security and 4300A Sensitive Systems Handbook.

label: Submit Documentation of Training Completion
quote: documentation of completion of training must be submitted to the COR.

label: Annual Training Completion During Transition Period
quote: Each contractor employee and subcontractor must annually complete this training during the transition period of the option year.

label: Prohibition on Work Without Training Completion
quote: Any contractor employee or subcontractor who did not complete this training will not be allowed to perform work related to this SOW.

label: Information System Accreditation to FIPS Level for PII
quote: the contractor will Accredit (ATO) this information system to the (HHM) FIPS level

label: Hardware, Software, and Services Compliance with DHS 4300A
quote: All hardware, software, and services provided under this task order must be compliant with DHS 4300A Policy Directive (Version 13.3, February 13, 2023).

label: Encryption Compliance with FIPS 197 AES 256 and FIPS 140-2
quote: FIPS 197 (Advanced Encryption Standard (AES)) 256 algorithm and cryptographic modules that have been validated under FIPS 140-2.
